Reviews.Title: Really Lovin' This Camera So Far!
Reviews.Author: Prophetess O. W. Petcoff "Prophetess1"
Reviews.Content: Let me begin my saying that I have not purchased a new camera in six years, so I was waaaayyyy behind in technology (I had never purchased an SD card until now, etc.). I had read so much about the user manual to this camera being hard to read, the camera functions being hard to access and use, etc., but, I must say, I found this camera easy to use and the functions were well-explained and documented in the user manual (for Pete's sake, they show the pics and give step-by-step instructions in the manual :-)).I ordered this camera from Amazon last Friday; it arrived today. We are using it to take on a cruise with us and I wanted something with a decent zoom to be able to take pictures at somewhat of a distance. I also needed to practice using it, so I took it out of the box right away. I looked at the user manual and went to work :-D. I also used the user manual on the enclosed CD. No problem!Like another poster said, I, too, researched this camera a lot before buying it and I, too, found it comparable to a couple of the Fuji Finepix that I was looking at. I am in no way an expert on cameras (I don't know much about them at all), but, I did go try this one out at Sears prior to purchasing this one from Amazon (Amazon was cheaper). While there, I noticed that they also had the Fuji I was thinking about getting, too, and I tried it. I really do like the way the GE X5 feels in my hands better than the Fuji! And, with my not needing the camera for professional purposes, I just wanted to be able to take decent pics. And, the GE camera seems to be able to do that!I am soooo excited about this camera. The pics are so clear and sharp! I am having to learn how to focus it, etc., but, so far I have gotten some good clear shots.I wanted to address some common comments that I have seen about this camera, both on Amazon and other other sites that sell this camera:1. Using Manual to Get Clearer Pics of People Up Close - Previous reviewers were saying that their pics of people up close were blurry. Other reviewers suggested to take the pics in Manual as opposed to Automatic. I don't necessarily agree with this. In fact, with my not knowing what I was doing :-), I took blurry pics in both Manual and Auto, but I took more blurry pics in Manual. What did, in fact, help me to not blur the pictures was to follow the instructions in clicking the button to take the pics. If you read the manual, it tells you to push the button half-way down to focus the pic. Once you do, you will hear a tone (unless you disable the sound feature, I guess). Once you hear the tone, press the button the rest of the way down until you hear a shutter click sound, which lets you know that the pic has been taken. Pressing it all the way down too soon caused my pics to be blurry.2. Picture Quality is Poor - People have said that the pic quality is poor. I do not agree with that. But, what I did see (and, again, I have lived in the dark ages regarding technology for so long until it might be this way with many digital cameras that I don't know about), though, is that the pic as it appears on the LCD screen is VERY GRAINY. This is true when the pic is being taken. However, if you go back and review the pics, you will see that they are not grainy (if taken correctly).3. This Camera is Not for Beginners/It is an Advanced Beginner Camera - As I stated earlier, I don't agree with that. Now, let me say that there are features that I do not know how to use on this camera and may never know how to use because I may never have a need to use them. But, you don't have to use the "advanced" features in order to be able to use this camera. I'm a living witness :-D.I am glad that I purchased this camera on Amazon, even though it went up $10 in my cart on literally the day I had it in the basket :-). Overall (so far), I am quite pleased with this camera.Oh, one more thing: At the time of my writing this, if you look at the What's in the Box? section, you will see that it lists 4 AA alkaline batteries are included with this camera. But, if you look at the Product Description portion, you will see that it lists 4 rechargeable AA batteries. I received the alkalines. The alkalines are doing well so far, but I will buy some rechargeables to take on the cruise with me. I have reported this discrepancy on the page to Amazon customer service and they may be fixing it soon.UPDATE ON DECEMBER 17, 2010:I wrote a very positive review of this camera, but I am now seeing many negative reviews. When I bought my camera, it was sold and shipped directly from Amazon. Now I see that it is coming directly from Capital. I don't know if there would be a difference in the camera or not; shouldn't be. My camera did not ship from Capital and I have had no problems with it. I am adding this to my review because I don't want people to think that I am endorsing a camera that may not be of good quality.

Reviews.Title: Excellent camera for the money
Reviews.Author: whirlpool78
Reviews.Content: I wanted to learn more about photography without breaking the bank since this is an experiment for me I would have hated to invest a ton of money in a camera just to find that the hobby was not for me.  I looked at "inexpensive" DSLRs with kit lenses and well as various bridge cameras and even some P&S; Canons what I could use the CHDK with to extend the functionality.  Ultimately I decided that I wanted a bridge camera because I wanted more control and zoom over what most P&Ss; offer but I didn't want to invest a ton of money in lens with a DSLR.  I was intialy interested in the Fuji Finepix S2550 but after discovering that it didn't have a real aperture and since part of this was to learn more about digital photography I decided against that line.  I ultimately decided on the GE X5 for several reasons.1) It has a real aperture priority mode2) It had the ability to do continuous AF3) It could shoot video with optical zoom and little/no motor noise4) It could do last 3 burst at full 14MP5) It has a single press multiple shot smile detect mode which I love to use for family self portraits which with 3 kids the one shot on a set timer just isn't enough for me.6) The default mode of of the shutter is release priority which when coupled with constant AF means no missed moments while the camera focuses.7) An AF assist lamp for night photos8) The story of how General-Imaging came to be with retired execs from Olympus and Minolta getting together to make a new inexpensive camera company got me interested.These things being said there are a couple things about the camera I wish were different.1) A manual focus mode2) EV Bracketing3) HD Video4) MPEG4 video encodingOne gripe I often hear with this camera which is actually a feature I like is that the camera does not focus completely when the button is full pressed without an intermediate half press.  In DSLRs this is called release priority.  The default behavior of this camera is to auto focus on a half press and take a picture on a full press unless you turn the continuous auto focus feature on in which case the camera is always focusing.  Most P&S; cameras are focus priority which means if the button is pressed the camera focuses then takes a picture a half press just speeds that process up a little by letting you prefocus.  People used to this behavior may hate this camera as single full button presses may result in blurry pictures.  I love this feature though because I can't even begin to count how many times I have missed a moment with other P&S; cameras when I press the button just to have whatever it was I was trying to capture change while the camera focuses.  If I am shooting portraits of the kids I always half press to lock focus and then full press when the moment is right, and if I want subsequent pics I just keep pressing because the camera is already in focus from the last picture and I know it won't refocus before the next shot.  In action situations I turn on continuous AF and snap away to my hearts content, basically I am trading battery life for the ability to get instantaneous photos.Ultimately I think the price this camera is insanely good.  There are a couple of shortcomings that effect pretty much all bridge cameras and I have seen them mentioned here as flaws in this camera.  First indoor/night photos are not as good as some other cameras.  This is pretty much the case for all bridge cameras because even though the camera form factor is DSLR like the sensor inside is still small P&S; type sensor which means less light is falling on the sensor vs a DSLR which have bigger sensors and bigger glass lens that let more light in.  If you want superior dark photo taking ability you will need a DSLR no questions about it.  One saving grace for this camera though is dark frame subtraction.  What this means is if you take night pictures using a long shutter speed the camera will actually take 2 pictures, one with the shutter open and one closed.  It will then automatically correct the shutter open picture by removing sensor noise by using the picture taken with the shutter closed as a reference.  This means more noise free night long exposure shots than you get with a similar camera.Another issue is lens sharpness.  This camera is good in this regard, but not on par with say a Panasonic bridge camera.  The thing is all bridge cameras have insane lens configurations going from wide angle to super telephoto.  To pull off this change with a DSLR you would need several interchangeable lenses but all of these pieces of glass in the optical path mean that the light is being bent a lot and it will never be as sharp as a camera with a more limited range.Finally depth of field.  These sorts of cameras generally have a very wide depth of field which means it becomes more and more difficult to pull off the portrait shots with the fuzzy out of focus background we are so used to seeing from professional cameras.  I have read many many explanations why this is and often they discussions get heated as to the cause, is it the focal length of the lens, the limited aperture, the size of the sensor etc etc.  What ever the reason all P&S; type cameras have a hard time making the depth of field shallow in anything other than Macro mode so don't expect a lot with this type camera.

Reviews.Title: IMO, a rebadged Fuji
Reviews.Author: RS
Reviews.Content: I did quite a bit of research before making this purchase ($130 at Walmart). It's a 'bridge' camera with features like a point-and-shoot, but the body style of a SLR. There aren't many reviews around or sample pics, probably due to the relative inexpensiveness of this camera, and the lack of a puffy, brand name. But if you just look closely at the physical framework of the shell, then compare the menu system to Fuji's of this caliber (download their manuals), you won't doubt my claim; when you take some pics, you'll know. 'Rebadging', or remarking, is not a new selling strategy. It has been used by the auto industry, electronics industry, and computer software industry, to name a few.Just check out my pics above, the macros of the Lily and cone flower (2 pics ea. with a 1:1 of each to compensate for Amazon's limited picture quality) and the lamp post shots (3, normal, 15x and full zoom). I could get so close with macro that I could practically touch the lens to the objects (with good light), and using full zoom you can see the screw threads of the bolts of the lamp post. This has been on QVC a few times for $169 (retail, $270), and they always claim to sell over 500 in less than an hour. The color is incredible. I compared it with a Panasonic DMC-TZ3 at comparable zoom and dpi (8MP), and the color and clarity were significantly improved. The TZ3 is $160 'Used' on Amazon.I don't know how some of these reviewers can mark this camera down unless they work for a competitor, or they just don't know how to use one (really, no manual zoom? lol). The battery life is good also. I use cheap rechargeables. The image stabilization was demonstrated by the company at a recent electronics show where they mounted it on a heavily vibrating platform yet it still took a clean, focused shot. It works great.Even if it Isn't a Fuji, it's a solid, reliable, fun camera with more capability than most people really need.*** Still using this baby with no problems. I did accidentally allow spilled juice to get into it and clog it up so badly that it wouldn't open the lens and the buttons stuck. To the rescue came my trusty 'contact cleaner'. Never heard of this amazing stuff? Well, contact cleaner is normally used to clean electrical contacts, such as the contacts in a wall socket, the contacts of rotary switches and any other electronic contacts in plug or switch form that will collect contaminants, carbon deposits and corrosion over time, effecting the functionality of the device. One squirt of this contact cleaner solves many electrical problems. It is usually electrically non-conductive and dries fast with no residue -- it's as though you never used it. Some brands do harm plastic, so you have to be cautious and 'read the label'.But wait, it's also perfect for cleaning anything else that you wouldn't want to use water on that's in a hard-to-reach location (it has a fine spray tube for such purposes), such as the inside of my GE X5. Well, it took nearly a can of spray (at $8 per can) and I could only just guess where to spray into the camera (through the battery compartment, etc.) to wash out the juice, but it worked and it was cheaper than buying a new camera or letting a repair service take weeks to clean it out the hard way. Just thought you could use this tip.

Reviews.Title: Not the best GE camera but still worth the $149..
Reviews.Author: Crystal D.
Reviews.Content: I own the GE E1030 10MP Digital Camera with 3x Optical Zoom (Silver) and decided I'd like to update mine so I picked the X5. The X5 has all kinds of new features that the old one didn't but the image quality didn't really get any better than the old one. Still the batteries last long(still haven't timed them), the image stabilization is good but I try to avoid using it because it adds more noise to the pictures. The video & audio quality is mediocre at best and I don't know if it's just me or what because when I turn the camera on and move it around, it makes a high pitched sound that the microphone picks up during recording. Still all those problems can be easily fixed during editing, so if you don't mind a little work for a great image then I recommend this camera.

Reviews.Title: Fantastic Camera for the Price
Reviews.Author: corgi11
Reviews.Content: I have been using this camera for about 2 weeks now and I have read the good and bad reviews. I find this camera terrific and a great buy for the price. For all the people who gave this camera a bad review leave me suggest the following that I did.1. Go to the GE imaging home page for the X5 camera and download and install the latest firmware.2. Really read the instruction manual3. Make sure you press the shutter button down halfway and hold it until the camera focuses before you snap the picture.Updating the firmware made a big difference, and by following the above steps I get consistently great pictures.You can't beat all the features of this camera for the price!!!

Reviews.Title: Great Camera for the Money
Reviews.Author: Boots
Reviews.Content: After researching all the bridge cameras out there I had pretty much decided that to get the quality I wanted I would need to pay at least $350.  But then last week while on vacation my old Canon G2 suddenly quit on me and I had to pick up a replacement in a hurry.  Found the X5 at Kmart and I feel I got really lucky with this.  It is an amazing camera for the money.  Does everything the more expensive cameras does, has great picture quality and is easy to use.  There are a few shortcomings but nothing that is a deal breaker.  Macro mode is not great and video quality is just passable but otherwise it is fantastic.  I'm really impressed with the picture quality for such an inexpensive camera.  I've used many digital cameras and SLR's over the years and I am perfectly happy with this one.  No manual focus but the auto focus does a good job.  Continuous mode is kind of slow, only 2 frames per second and it needs to be set each time you shoot.  It has manual mode which is missing from most cameras in this price range.  Great deal overall and highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: Decent for the price
Reviews.Author: Kent Leinbach
Reviews.Content: Bought this to replace my beloved Fuji S1500 which I dropped.... I could have bought the Fuji S1800 for about $50 more than the GE, but I'm saving for a DSLR and the GE has the same body as my Fuji so I assume it comes from the same manufacturer.  For the price it is an excellent camera.  The long shutter (up to 30 seconds) is really nice, but it essentially never focuses at night, when that would be most useful.  It has difficulty focusing under various conditions - livable but a bummer generally.  I would think without a confirmed focus it would default to infinity, but it does not.  Generally image quality seems quite nice, long zoom is good.  Image stabilization works well with even my shaky hands on a long zoom.  The light gathering is great!  You get excellent light gathering and even blue skys at night - but it's all out of focus almost all the time (at night).  Day time performance is fine, but with occasional focusing problems.  If it would simply focus at night I would rate this a super value for the very low coin, but I must admit I'm disappointed.The video quality seems pretty good, audio quality is about what you'd expect from any camera but I'd say good overall.  The zoom is quiet - on my Fuji you would not zoom under video as it captured the sound and it was super loud, and the GE does well there, though you will still hear it.The aperture setting is disappointing - my Fuji really showed good depth of field on wide F stop (blurry background but subject in focus), but the GE seems to still get good focus on the entire image.  If you like the aperture effect of the central image in focus but the rest blurred you might look elsewhere, if that isn't important it is fine.Many of the various image modes work fine, for example black and white does a nice job of processing and the panorama mode works pretty well with some neat results.Controls are overall intuitive with a few exceptions.  Shot to shot times are fine but maybe a bit slow, but this camera is very low cost so I'll rate that acceptable.If you want to play around with manual controls this is a fine starter camera, but it has limits.  For the price a bargain - but don't expect a DSLR.

Reviews.Title: Question other reviews
Reviews.Author: Michael A. Hudson
Reviews.Content: First, I want to point out that this is just a preliminary review. I researched cameras in this class for quite a while before ordering. When you look at the price and then look at the features offered, something just does not seem right. I read several bad reviews about this camera ( poor picture quality - stabilization not working - hard to use and understand with poor instructions - fuzzy LCD screen - etc.) You would almost expect this to be true at this price, but I have learned over the years, that for the most part, if a product does not carry the name of a major player ( Nikon - Canon - Kodak etc) they are immediately considered inferior.  One of the main reasons I gave this camera a shot is that not long ago I bought another GE camera ( 1486tw ) when I was looking for a pocket camera. I was very satisfied with that camera and the quality and value has continued with the X5. From the time I opened the box, I was impressed. The fit and finish was on a par with any of the best brands. If you have ever had a digital camera, you will not even need the instructions - It is that intuitive to use. So far, I have seen none of the problems complained about in those reviews I spoke of. In my opinion, you will not find a camera with this quality and features at even 1 1/2 times the price. I would recommend this X5 to anyone wanting a camera with the feel of an SLR and the ability to do everything that the SLR's are capable of. It is simple enough for the first time user and will challenge the artistic skills of the advanced user.

Reviews.Title: The Supercamera
Reviews.Author: Adrian Vance "adrianvance"
Reviews.Content: I was the West Coast Editor of POPULAR PHOTOGRAPHY for four years, 1974 - 1978, writing a monthly column for the magazine after 14 years of photo production in educational filmstrip and book production.  We used to talk about what a "supercamera" would be when producers and photographers would speculate on it.  This camera is about as close to all our fantasies as anything can be.  It fits the hand well, could be operated single handedly, the image stabilization makes the 400 mm equivalent usable, the image quality is fantasic.  It has about five times the pixel information we had in the finest 35 mm camera/film combinations.  It sells for a small fraction what we paid for the same capabilities, to say nothing over the costs of film and processing.  And, you get to see it all now!  You can edit out the bad shots while you're still on the trip.  One 16 gig chip holds 4500 pictures!  It is quite literally hard to believe.

Reviews.Title: great
Reviews.Author: Cara Manes "olive"
Reviews.Content: this is my second camera so this is amazing to me the photos are great so many features. the paper manuel is useless so just use the cd. some of the features are a little complicated to get to but the work well. it has 480p video which is ok for the price, the build is solid, but the batterie cover moves. there is a continues/ burst mode other wise there is a little delay between photos. there is not much of a delay that i can tell between pressing the button and the photo being taken. i suggest buying at ritz camera and printing out a page off of amazon saying it 130$ they will give you that price and free photography classes. i recommend this to any beginner, which is what i am.

Reviews.Title: so far so good
Reviews.Author: teacherewiew
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera for classroom work, so far it works fine. It takes good pictures  and it is easy to use. The panoramic view is great for taking pics of the whole class and the prints are of good quality, I own a more expensive Nikon DSLR that I didn't want to use for work, so for the price and my purposes I would say its a pretty good camera.

Reviews.Title: GE X5 Digital Camera
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer "Digital Shutter Bug"
Reviews.Content: I got this camera because I was looking at replacing my Fuji S series camera and this one caught my eye. It has the same body as the Fuji S1000. The camera was only $145 so it wasn't too hard on the pocket. The camera itself is fun to use. The continous shot mode is confusing to find and required searching the book (which comes on CD or can be downloaded from the internet). The Panoramic feature is easy to use but takes pratice. The directions are different than the Fuji that I am use to but it is a fun and easy camera to use. The Exposure Compensation Button doesn't seem to do anything. Other functions on this camera are easy to use and work well. I have only had the camera for two days but I am enjoying it. It is well worth the money as it is a great little camera for what you are getting. I would recomend aquiring a new strap. The one that they give you is rough on the neck.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera for the price
Reviews.Author: Douglas Vickers
Reviews.Content: Haven't had camera very long,Picture quality is good. Panorama is a lot of fun. Camera takes better picture than I hoped.Very pleased.

Reviews.Title: Is overall good, good enough?
Reviews.Author: Joe L. Stallard
Reviews.Content: This camera is good for the quality of pictures it takes. They are clear, crisp, and the camera can zoom in quickly.The down side: this camera came with a flaw in the body. The part that fits above the case and holds the flash, has a gap in it. This gap appears to be an ill fitting piece. I can push it down and it will snap into place but will some how came back up. My fear is that dust will make it's way into the body. You would think a brand new camera would have better fitting body parts. I plan to contact the repair center to see if this is a flaw of the design.I hate to have something that is brand new and needs a repair when it comes out of the box!

Reviews.Title: Low Priced Wunderkind. Could become a "cult" camera like a LOMO
Reviews.Author: John S. Socha
Reviews.Content: First, let me tell you that I teach and write about digital cameras, and am a "how-to" regular guest on (WI) Public Radio, where I answer questions from average consumers. So, while I am not a newbie, I spent a lot of time with folks who are, and my upcoming book, "How To Use The Digital Camera You Just Bought!" is aimed at that group.I also love bargain cameras that perform way beyond their expectations. This camera is one of them. As long as you are not trying to do indoor action sports shots of your kid, you will find this camera can handle most situations.BTW, other reviewers claim there is no manual exposure setting. They apparently missed the >>>>RED M<<<<<< on the dial that is for full manual operation. How they could have missed this is beyond me!Other cool things include the ability to easily compose a 3-shot panoramic image, with the camera internally stitching three images. The camera uses the same style of capture as the latest pricey Sony "Camera of the Year" SLR!  You take one shot, then move the camera to align the marks on the screen and the camera takes the next shot! Do this a third time and you are done!The camera is no more or less baffling in terms of controls than any other camera. So, if it seems to difficult, you need to take a class, read a book, or sit patiently while someone who knows cameras explains it to you.  There are no "Nerf" digital cameras at this time. Digital cameras are not rocket-science, but they take some effort to sort out. One of my radio listeners got his camera figured out, and he's 98 years old. So don't start thinking you can't learn it because you are too old!This camera may or may not hold up for as many years as more expensive cameras, but at the price, it offers a wealth of features that many have spent two or three times the price to obtain.  It has the potential of becoming a "cult" camera, as in the LOMO. It even has the same finish!The only downside is that it takes 4 AA batteries where similar cameras take 2, and the auto white balance is not quite up to snuff.  But with smile detection, face detection and even blink warning, it adds up to quite a package. Good luck!

Reviews.Title: Great for sports!
Reviews.Author: gammy
Reviews.Content: This is a great camera!! Video on zoom is very high quality. You have to play around with the camera and get use to which setting works best for different locations. You can adjust for lighting. Lots of flexability without being too complicated. I have gotten some amazing motion shots captured in my pictures. This is a perfect camera for the parent or grandparent of an athlete. You will not be disappointed!

Reviews.Title: GE X5  Good Value
Reviews.Author: Daniel Garza
Reviews.Content: I have had my GE X5 for about 30 days now, I like it, it's easy to use and take great photos. I have not had any problems with it, Yes you can spend more for a better camera but why? If you are not a pro in photography this little X5 will serve you well. The best thing I can say is the X5 does alot for what you pay.

Reviews.Title: Paul's family digital camera
Reviews.Author: Paul Hobson "Petrol Blue"
Reviews.Content: We have been looking for a digital camera with a view lens (as opposed to just a screen on the back of the camera) as in bright daylight I have found it virtually impossible to see the pictures I am taking.Pricing for this type of camera has been $400+, this is the first we have seen at the $150 price.The ease of use and quality of picture has been superb, and with the choice of viewing via lens or sceeen (touch button changeover) I can use whichever is most appropriate for the light conditions.With the GE name I had confidence in its quality and that has so far proven to be correct.  I would recommend this camera for the person who does not want to spend $500 plus, but is looking for a more versitile camera than a point / shoot / hope one.

Reviews.Title: SOOOOO glad I got this
Reviews.Author: Smart Buyer
Reviews.Content: I spent ALOT of time reading reviews for different cameras. I can't afford a DSLR right now, but wanted more than just a little point and shoot. I saw this on the Sears web site and shopped around to see who had the best price on it. I read reviews on every site I could find. There were mostly really good reviews and some really bad ones. The bad ones sounded more like people who had gotten a bad camera or bought from a shady company.I am so glad I went ahead and bought it. I have had it for about 2 weeks now and have taken pics in several different conditions. I have shot rain, shine, night, inside, outside, moving objects, still objects, among other things. My pics turned out really well in all scenes. It was really easy to use. I like using the more manual settings as opposed to the auto. The auto mode works, but I think my pics turned out better when I set the camera for my scene. It was really easy to upload the pics to my computer too. They looked really good on the computer, but I wanted to wait until I had some printed out before I left my review, just to make sure that they printed looking as good as they did on the computer. Well, they look even better.I got several smaller shooting sessions off of the batteries it came w/. I turned it off when I had longer pauses between shots. I also use the electronic viewfinder to shoot instead of the screen. That seemed to really help preserve my battery life. I did buy some Enloop rechargable batteries to use in it. Sanyo Eneloop 4 Pack AA NiMH Pre-Charged Rechargable Batteries w/ Charger And I bought the Zeikos ZE-CA48B Deluxe Soft Medium Camera and Video Bag Zeikos ZE-CA48B Deluxe Soft Medium Camera and Video Bag to put it in.All in all, I am VERY happy w/ this camera. I highly recommend it. I found the best price on Amazon. Always do.

Reviews.Title: Novice photographer
Reviews.Author: Lori
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera when it first came out. There are absolutely no reviews on it and so I made the blind purchase simply based on the price. I was looking for a new (and better) camera since my little "point and shoot" camera was on the fritz. I never used anything but "automatic" before so buying this camera meant I would have to do some research on how to work with manual settings and other things. A simple find on google taught me all I needed about the different settings and how to use them correctly. Now my pictures are amazing and I am absolutely in love with this camera. Although I am still learning I find that this camera is very simple to use (and I certainly don't know much about cameras). It does get a little noisy if you move it too much but I think that it's the camera attempting to focus as you are moving since it doesn't make the noise if I am perfectly still. There are also several features that are great to use when you don't have time to manually adjust the settings yourself. Everyone loves my photos and always ask what camera I have. Once I tell them the brand and price they all are shocked since the photo quality is amazing!I am so happy I made this purchase and definitely recommend people invest in this great camera!

Reviews.Title: GE X5 DigiCam
Reviews.Author: NGA Mountain Man
Reviews.Content: I found the camera easy to set up and begin using within minutes.  After a few trial and error pictures I was on my way to the best pictures I've taken in years.  I had been using a Sony Cyber Shot 7MP camera for several years.  The more powerful zoom feature and resolution made closeups even better.  The menu system was so easy to use and to make changes.  If you aren't a fussy camera buff but still want clear sharp pictures....buy this camera!.

Reviews.Title: Did the research
Reviews.Author: Pepper
Reviews.Content: I just gave this camera to my daughter for her 19th birthday.  She loves it!  Was so amazed at the sharpness and vivid colors of photos.  Have many neat features that she was trying out and loved, is one sharp little camera for a great price.  Was shipped quickly from amazon! I myself have a SRS camera and a old little point and shoot digital camera.  Am  looking to buy myself this camera also from amazon, cheapest place around for this item.  All I can say is to give this a try, doubt u will be disappointed in this camera.  :)

Reviews.Title: excellent camera
Reviews.Author: Jeep girl
Reviews.Content: I compared several cameras before I purchased the GE X5. After looking at other reviews, price, and features, I found the X5 offered so much more for the money. I have used several features and find all of them easy to use. I also like the shape and size of this camera. It is not heavy and big enough that it is easy to handle. When in a hurry, you can just grab it and know which way it goes. With my old camera, I had to look at it, make sure it was facing the right way, make sure it was right side up, and then get ready for the shot.  My neighbor is a professional photographer and he couldn't believe I got such a good camera for such a reasonable price. I highly recommend this camera for the size, shape, price, ease of use, features, and quality of the pic. Very pleased.

Reviews.Title: GE X5 Power Pro
Reviews.Author: roscoesixtynine
Reviews.Content: An average Joe review,I don't know much about photography, I'm more the computer geek type. My inner geek tells me price/feature ratio is high for this camera. For the price this camera takes outstanding pictures. Battery life is impressive(with rechargeables) Fairly simple user interface - and I can't say it enough - OUTSTANDING PICTURES ! Go for it....save some cash - buy this camera, and take great pictures with features that you'd pay much more for on a camera with a different name on the side. ....you deserve it !!

Reviews.Title: Don't let it trick you
Reviews.Author: SnowMan
Reviews.Content: I should start with context. This is the second digital camera I've owned, and the last one was an ancient hand me down. I'm a bit behind the times...This camera is feature dense. The zoom is well advertised, and it functions beautifully, but there's a trap. I've discovered that often, about half the time I adjust the zoom, I should have picked up and moved. So, while the zoom is a great resource to have, it can be overused. There are also ways to adjust the aperture, exposure, color saturation, and a dozen things I haven't figured out yet. While all of this is wonderful, I guess this falls in the ease of use category as I suppose a camera with fewer features would tempt one to adjust fewer settings, and thus be easier.Battery life is a legitimate concern, but fortunately this camera runs on ubiquitous AA batteries. A set of rechargeable batteries and a backup set of alkaline gets me through even a pretty long day, and replacements are absolutely everywhere, so it's never been a real hindrance.My only problem with this camera; it was a challenge to find a case. After a little creative shopping, the M-Rock Vista is a great fit and a really solid bag. Highly recommended.To wrap up, takes great photos, feels good in the hand, has a really nice weight to it, has enough features to keep one busy, and keeps on chugging after a fair bit of punishment. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: More value for the buck
Reviews.Author: Carolm
Reviews.Content: As a retired photographer I was surprised by the features on this camera. I used to run my 35s & medium format cameras on manual for all different subjects I looked at the Canon & Nikon & find that both of them have very similar features in their point & shoot camera line but at double or triple the price. My guess is they all use the same or very similar electronics in their cameras, but because it says Canon or Nikon you are paying for the name. Try this camera you may be surprised

Reviews.Title: Wonderful Camera
Reviews.Author: Joseph W. Hinton "Joseph W Hinton"
Reviews.Content: Just received this camera and I love it.  It takes very good pictures and is easy to figure out. 15x optical zoom is awesome. I figured it was just a basic camera because of the price but was surprised to see all the features it has.  I work for General Electric and was happy to see that we make such good cameras.

Reviews.Title: A worthy replacement for my 6 yr old CMOS camera
Reviews.Author: modconspiracy
Reviews.Content: The last time I purchased my own camera was 6 years ago. It was a CMOS sensor 5 megapixel camera. It has served me well and handed down to my 8 yr old for his personal camera, to use my husband's Nikon Coolpix which also has served us well. Now that I have this, my husband can reclaim his. Usually used the camera for family outings and pictures for ebay. I have just began dabbling with the options that are afforded in this model. I am pleased with the quality of the pictures. I have compared the pics to more expensive brands and there is quite a difference but I am content with the quality of the camera and the pics I have taken I am led to believe I truly have no reason to dish out a few hundred dollars more for a well known pioneer brand for digital cameras when I am not a professional photographer and probably never will be. This product is worth every penny on its price tag if brand doesn't matter to you. Definitely a good buy.

Reviews.Title: AMAZONS BEST DEAL YET
Reviews.Author: Terry LeeTusing
Reviews.Content: I JUST RECEIVED THE GE X5 YESTERDAY FROM AMAZON. I HAVE MANY CAMERAS BOTH POINT AND SHOOT AND DIGITAL SLRS.THE X5 IS SUPERIOR.I TESTED IT OUT LAST NIGHT.THE MACRO DOES AN EXCELLENT JOB.I WILL BE TRYING ALL THE FUNCTIONS TODAY.THE PRICE IS FANTASTIC.I HAVE PAID MUCH MORE FOR SOME OF MY OTHER POINT AND SHOOT CAMERAS AND THIS GE OUT PERFORMS THEM ALL.THERE ARE SO MANY WONDERFUL FUNCTIONS.EASY TO USE AND FANTASTIC PICTURE QUALITY.I LOVE THIS CAMERA.THANK YOU AMAZON F0R A GREAT DEAL.

Reviews.Title: Very pleased
Reviews.Author: Kim Stewart
Reviews.Content: I wanted an upgrade, from a Kodak snap and shoot, this camera was my choice after ton's of searching.I take photo's of everything, from my nephew and dog to the nature and my surrounding's. And this camera is GREAT for all.I've had it for almost a month and have used it and practiced with it almost everyday. It has great zoom and take's really nice panoramic shot's (you just have to slow down when doing the panoramic), it also is great on catching thing's in motion, such has a VERY active 2 year old.I am VERY happy with my choice in this camera. I was going to buy a much more expensive one, but am glad I didn't. It has every feature that I wanted with a much better price. The only downfall for this camera is that it use's AA batteries, but I've only had to change batteries 1 time in the month that I've had it. And I just bought some rechargeable batteries to save money.I will and have already recommended this camera to my friends and family.

Reviews.Title: Best digital camera I have ever had!
Reviews.Author: MrJay58 "jaynsatx"
Reviews.Content: GE makes cameras?  Bought this camera before Christmas and used it at office parties, Christmas day, New Years night and a Bat Mitzvah!  Used manual for night outdoor photos without a flash-- great pics!  Remembering to pop up the flash is about the only problem Ive had.  Used the video for some karaoke-- sound was good.  Uses Apples .MOV...I like all that it can do...real zoom lens...not grainy...got it for a great price on AMAZON ($115 with shipping)...just a great camera!  A nice step up from my Nikon Coolpix 20, and Canon 540.UPDATE: 10-10-2011Had this camera 10 months and love it even more!  Took it on vacation and the panarama "stiching" is soooo cool!  The video is nice, portraits, and especially the Sunset settings!  Awesome camera!!!

Reviews.Title: Miata of digital cameras
Reviews.Author: Camera newbie
Reviews.Content: The GE X5 Pro digital camera is like a Miata - sexy, agile, quick, and smooth to operate.  Nice camera to select for digital camera newbie.  Better than the digital cameras that fit in the pocket, and not as expensive or complicated as the digital SLRs.  Good range in zoom, crisp lens, easy to use, feels reflexive in the hand.  Wonderful LED screen, and excellent image crrection.  One major gripe - next geneation XE Pro, add AC adaptor.  The X5 sucks the life out of 4 AA batteries.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera, Super Value
Reviews.Author: foto_guy
Reviews.Content: I recently purchased the GE X5 and am pleased with the camera's features and functionality.  I'm a photographer and wanted this as my "portable" travel camera.  Although compact, has feel of an SLR and the Schneider wide/zoom is quite versatile.  A fun camera with such lens and @ 14 mp for this price is definitely a value!  I recommend it for its features and thus far image results for me have been superb.  GE in my opinion has scored five stars with this product.

Reviews.Title: Fabulous Pictures
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: I am really enjoying this camera. The features are not hard to understand and I'm getting better and better at taking awesome looking pictures. Love the picture quality. The video quality is not that great though but it could be the lighting in my house. The zoom is awesome too. The down side is it doesn't come with a rechargeable battery pack. It take AA batteries so I purchased rechargeable batteries. Great price for an awesome camera

Reviews.Title: Happy
Reviews.Author: John A. Smith "Choral Man"
Reviews.Content: This camera is a great value for the price. Very happy with the seller. Shipping was prompt and securely packaged. The camera is GREAT. I have to admit that I really had to wonder about a digital camera made by GE...I had no idea they ever made a camera, let alone a great digital one. The zoom is excellent. I like the panorama mode where it takes 3 pictures (2 are automatically taken once you take the first), and then stitches the panoramic pic within the camera on the spot. Nice feature. The overall quality of the photos is excellent. For the price, I HIGHLY recommend this camera if you are looking for an easy-to-use camera with tons of options.

Reviews.Title: GE X5 Camera
Reviews.Author: George T. Sumner "Tow Shooter 1"
Reviews.Content: This camera exceeded my expectations because it is such a low price for all the bells and whistles. It's vivid color is like much higher priced cameras. I use it at night under street lights of mercury and sodium vapor lights. It really makes clear and startling pictures under severe conditions. The auto mode and the scene mode work great. I highly recommend it. "By George"

Reviews.Title: Great for the Price
Reviews.Author: Victoria N Swift
Reviews.Content: Simply put. You pay 100 bucks for a camera, this is more than a great value! If you want a higher quality camera, then pay 500 dollars and get it. I am very happy with this camera. Amazing for the price!

Reviews.Title: Definitely worth buying.
Reviews.Author: Donna Algeri
Reviews.Content: I did an extensive amount of research before purchasing this camera as a gift for a family member that loves photography. The camera itself is small, a good size for the person that it was purchased for.The camera is easy to use, has amazing features for the money spent, and for the most part takes great photos. There have been a few fuzzy pictures since using it, but since the item is new to the user the fuzzy pics may have been avoidable with experience.I would recommend this camera for anyone that is looking for a feature packed camera at a great price.

Reviews.Title: Awesome!
Reviews.Author: Connie
Reviews.Content: This is a Great Camera. I had researched cameras for about 6mths before deciding on this one. You will NOT be disappointed! It looks like a very expensive camera, is quality weight and has numerous features. It does much more than I have taken time to learn, but is easy none the less. I will learn as I go!! I Love the 15X zoom and the X5 image stabilization (lighting). Takes awesome pictures in the dark! Got some great wedding reception pictures this weekend. The only thing I don't like--and its not the cameras fault--is the battery life. Most all cameras eat the battery life, so I purchased rechargeable batteries & charger! The price was right & was shipped timely. Try it!! You will love it too! Connie

Reviews.Title: Good Camera
Reviews.Author: BF
Reviews.Content: This is a "Very Good" digital camera, not great but pretty close.In order to get a great shot you need to know what settings to turn on. For instance, if you want to take a close up of a flower there is a option for that on the turn dial marked "SCN". When the menu shows up just select "Leaf" and start.The Movie mode is "OK". You can select 15 or 30 FPS, it could be better but it's $140 camera.It hates regular AA batters so get your self some Energizer L91BP-8 Lithium AA Photo Battery (8-Pack) instead, they well last alot longer.

Reviews.Title: Great Price for a Great Camera
Reviews.Author: smile01
Reviews.Content: I am very impressed with this camera.  I paid around $140.00 for it.  I read the reviews about this camera before purchasing it, and compared it to other cameras as well.  The reviews about this camera are true.  The camera is well worth the money, and it takes wonderful pictures.  I would recommend purchasing this camera if you are wanting great pictures/zoom power/etc..., and do not want to spend $400-$500.  Love the camera.

Reviews.Title: This camera is the bomb!
Reviews.Author: DJ
Reviews.Content: This is a replacement camera for a Canon SX200I and I love it.  Very easy to use. It has many features of much more expensive cameras. I would recommend to anyone.

Reviews.Title: Very Impressive Camera!!!
Reviews.Author: C. K. Anderson "Lightwing"
Reviews.Content: I have wanted to get into more photography for awhile but since this was a shot in the dark I didn't want to go into the deep end just yet. After reviewing several entry level DSLR styled cameras I found that this one fit my budget and exceeded my needs. Some may complain about the lack 720p video and may set the bar high when comparing this GE X5 to others like the Fuji Finepix and the Nikon Coolpix models but kicking this little guy off to the side for it's fancier mates would be a shame. This camera rocks and it takes some amazing shots. For me the shots taken with this camera really get to the soul of the object and photos remind me of the still quietness of retro photography but with modern ingenuity. The GE X5 has a professional look and feel and it even has just the right amount of weight without being awkward and fussy.  In total buy this camera because if your looking at this model more than once chances are you should be buying it. At a price point of $128 it's perfect for anyone just starting out or someone who needs a great camera for trips. And just a tip for those new to digital cameras get a class 6 SDHC card. I happened across this info from another reviewer who purchased a different camera and it really helps with the quality of the pictures.Thanks for reading and Good Luck

Reviews.Title: JUNK JUNK JUNK JUNK
Reviews.Author: M.A.FLICK "M.A.FLICK"
Reviews.Content: Its Been Many years since I've up-dated our camera equipment.The more I play with this Camera the more I like it.Pictures are very clear and crisp,wonderful color.The features are beyond what most people will ever use,but they all have there purpose and are GREAT Features.READ THE INSTRUCTIONS::You will have the hang of it in No Time at all.Small Camera Not Made For Big Hands,SORRY but I'm calling that just the way it is.Also Purchase a Good Recharger And Extra Batterys::Indoor shots using the flash eats-up batterys quick.I have back-up now.I also purchased several cards for this camera,now thats the way to do it.Photos,Videos,special events,cards for everything,hunting,fishing,you name it.All and all, really a good deal and I will come back after I use more of the features and let everyone know how they perform.UP-DATE-12/2/2011Ok here it is, after useing this camera for several months now I've had some problems with it not being able to locate files when I want to shoot pictures.The first time this happened it was a very important shoot for me.I shot 60 pictures and it dropped every DANG ONE OF THEM!!!!!!SAID IT COULD NOT LOCATE FILE....AAAAHHHHHHHH.....I was just SICK and I STILL AM!!!!!!!Anyway when you power up the camera make sure that your camera has found the correct file to store your photos In....Or you will lose everyone of them as I did.I'm still not sure why this happens and it has happened to me several times.AAAAHHHHHHH!!!!!Something to do with the memory I'm sure of that,and it is a DEFECT in the Camera itself.I'm going to send this one back for a replacement I purchased the warranty.I'll let everyone know how that adventure goes after I get a new Camera.M.A.FLICKI SHALL RETURN......

Reviews.Title: Excellent Buy for the Money
Reviews.Author: Charles Capko
Reviews.Content: I have not used this camera extensively yet, but I did spend a few hours taking pictures. I have used an old Nikon film camera with a removable lens for a photography class in college. (I think I still have the camera around somewhere.) But I have not done any serious photography since then. I generally use my cell phone camera (Motorola Droid) and a Nikon Coolpix point and shoot digital camera. I think I paid about the same for the Coolpix (several years ago) as I did for this GE camera, but the difference in quality is impressive.Without the flash, the GE and my old Nikon film camera take about the same quality pictures. Meaning, in bright sunlight or low light with a steady hand or tripod they both take pretty good pictures. The GE is far superior to the Coolpix camera though. The Coolpix camera takes about the same quality pictures with flash that the GE camera takes without. (Assuming there is enough light to read by.)In sunlight the GE camera works very well, assuming you have a steady hand. (Just like any camera.) Even with the zoom fully extended I was able to take pictures of the steeple of the local church that were completely in focus and looking very vibrant.There was a review that said they were disappointed in how "cheap" the camera felt. I can't disagree more. It feels like a solid piece of electronics. My old Nikon film camera felt more solid, but the GE is the most solid digital camera I have ever used. I suppose that there must be really nice SLR digital cameras out there, but I've never used them.This camera is a great buy for it's price ($130 at the time of this review) and if you want a camera that is better than a point and shoot or cell phone camera, but don't want to spend thousands of dollars to buy a nice SLR that you'll probably only use occasionally, then this is the camera for you.If you are a serious photography buff and will use the camera for more than just vacations and special occasions, then you might look into getting a real SLR camera instead.Final note: There are only two problems I have with the camera. #1 is that there is a single stuck pixel on the display. This happens sometimes and I'm not overly concerned by a single stuck pixel, but it was slightly disappointing out of the box. #2 is more serious though. It's a poor design choice on the part of GE. The SD card slot is inside the compartment for the batteries. You need to open the battery compartment (careful not to spill the batteries) in order to get the SD card out. With 8 and 16 gig SD cards available I don't see myself changing the card often, but I do like to use the SD card like a thumb drive in my machine instead of plugging in the cord. So it is something of a hassle to get the SD card in and out when I want to get pictures off of it. But it's unlikely that I would need to do it during an event due to the large capacity of available SD cards so it's not a deal breaker. The camera is still a excellent value for the price.Edit: Two weeks after I bought the camera the controls failed to respond. I could turn the camera on, but none of the buttons would work. It was also impossible to turn off without extracting the batteries. Amazon was quick and painless in the exchange process and I got the replacement camera (cross shipped) a week before I went on vacation. My mother actually put her $2,000 SLR camera away and just used mine instead because the GE camera was much more compact and shot nearly as good pictures, and at $130 we could afford to break it or have it snatched. (I was much more worried about losing the pictures on the SD card if it were snatched than the camera itself, I swapped out the 8 gig cards before they were even 25% filled just to ward against that possibility.) On the down side the new camera had a stuck pixel on the LCD as well, in the same place, or nearly the same place, so I fear that might be a defect that is common in this camera. The pictures taken in daylight looked great, the pictures taken in shade were also good if you used the flash for fill light, or have an extremely steady hand. The night pictures without flash were terrible unless I used a tripod, but with the flash on, they were just fine. The camera survived being used by me, my mother, and about a dozen different members of our host family in the Philippines, so it's fairly rugged if you don't drop it with the lens extended. It was dropped once in the grass and once onto a wooden table with the lens cap on and suffered no damage.The video quality is actually pretty good for a $130 camera. I was expecting it to be pretty terrible, but it exceeds the quality of most youtube videos, and really if you're taking video with a $130 camera, you aren't exactly looking for better than that are you?It's not a real replacement for an SLR camera for a serious photographer (or a camcorder for that matter), but for a vacation or outdoor/indoor event for a semi-experienced photographer that knows when to use flash and when not to, and how to hold a camera steady while it is auto-focusing and until the shutter closes then this is the camera for the budget conscious.

Reviews.Title: Happy so far
Reviews.Author: Amy L. Sciangula
Reviews.Content: I've had a Canon point and shoot for years but it has been on the fritz for months now.  I figured I would treat myself to a new camera for Christmas and was looking at the next step up from the Canon point and shoots. I was on Amazon doing comparisons when I found this little surprise.  A camera by GE with all of the bells and whistles for how much?  I was a bit skeptical but kept following the reviews that kept coming in over the weeks.  I bit the bullet and bought the camera last week and I have not been disappointed.  I am by no means a camera expert so I am still learning how to use this upgrade from what I am used to.  The pictures are amazing and I love the solid feel of this camera.  I prefer to have standard batteries in my camera since I can easily replace them with the stock pile I have at my house (little kids toys) but I know that is an issue for others.  As someone who uses their camera to take video and pictures of their kids I am really happy with this camera.  I have only taken one video as a test and the images were great but I still need to play with the sound option to see if that can be improved.  The only other thing I need to get used to is popping open the flash if I think I need it.  Not a huge deal and I pretty much do that to begin with now.  I took the memory card from my point and shoot and put it into this camera.  If you don't have a memory card available you will want to buy one.  I was only able to take 3 pictures without a card before the camera said it was full.

Reviews.Title: Loaded with features and a great buy
Reviews.Author: W. Allison "Eager Reader"
Reviews.Content: After using the camera for six weeks I am ready to write a little review.  This is very comfortable to hold and is loaded with features.  The quality is very good.  As others have noted, this appears to be a relabeled Fuji camera.I compared the GE (15x) to a Nikon Coolpix S6000 (7x).  The skinny Coolpix fits in a pocket easier but is much harder to hold. The programmed features are comprehensive and very similar - panorama picture stitching, multipoint autofocus, face recognition, etc.  The GE adds some additional manually selected programs, plus aperture priority, shutter priority and manual exposure.  The GE offers more choices in metering the light exposure.The GE has a pop-up flash which makes turning the flash on/off quick.  The elevated flash reduces red-eye.  The flash can be set to give a pre-flash which further reduces red-eye.  The night flash is good, balancing environmental light with fill-flash on the subject.  The flash range is very good, at least 25 feet.  The Nikon flash tends to get covered by a finger when holding the camera.  Nikon's flash range is not as far as GE's.The GE has a very sharp lens with very good multi-coating on the lens elements to reduce lens flare.  In the 14mp setting you can  actually see all those pixels.  GE and Nikon are equals here. But as expected for a 15x zoom, there is a slight barrel distortion at the shortest wide-angle focal length (FL).  The distortion is nearly invisible when extended to the same FL as the Nikon's widest angle. The distortion remains invisible until extended to the longest FL where a very slight pincushion effect occurs.  This is quite acceptable for all general photography.Some sensor flare (a purple colored ray) occurs when the camera is pointed directly at a bright light.  However, it is less than the flare in the Nikon.  Both are acceptable in this regard.Both cameras have image stabilization to reduce blurring if the camera shakes.  The GE is good, but the Nikon is slightly better.Movie mode is very sharp, but limited to a maximum 640x480 resolution.  You will usually want to turn on continuous autofocus in movie mode.  I experienced no dropped frames or image blocking.  The Nikon has an HD option.  The sound quality was only fair, but at least the mike was directional, which is reduces stray noises.  The Nikon sound was slightly better but seemed less directional.  Sound would improve with an externally mounted mike, but many movie cameras don't offer that either.The GE LCD display panel is sharp but could use more anti-reflective coatings. The Nikon has superior coatings on its display panel. Both have the same number of pixels. The GE has a good automatic LCD brightness adjustment which is lacking on the Nikon.GE has a very fine viewfinder with complete display functions and same resolution as the 3" panel.  The Nikon has no viewfinder.  The viewfinder saves some power and has no problems from ambient light. Most importantly, you can hold the camera against your face for a steady image and still see what you are filming.  The viewfinder is very important to me.  I wear glasses and use the viewfinder without any problem.The time required to take a picture is slightly longer with the GE than the Nikon.  At first, I thought the GE was slow, but once I learned its features, the time shortened noticeably.GE and Nikon both use two position shutter buttons.  The first position initiates the autofocus and exposure.  Pushing down all the way trips the shutter.  Shutter speeds are similar, about 4 seconds - 1/2000.  The GE offers very long exposures in the manual modes and also offers a selection of time-lapse exposures.Battery life is fair.  Alkaline batteries lasted about 250 pictures, mostly using the focus assist light, continuous autofocus, flash, and the display panel. Turning off one or more of those features could extend the battery life.  Rechargeable batteries might not work as well as expected.  To be fair, my rechargeable NiMH batteries are four years old and probably over-the-hill.  I noticed that the camera is conservative about turning on.  If any battery is under 1.30 volts, the camera doesn't want to start.  However, if you slide the ON switch a couple times, the camera may start and continue to work for quite some time.My model shipped with firmware version 2.03. Their website offers 1.05 so I have not tried different firmware.  The box contained an abbreviated 29 page manual. The CD-Rom had an 89 page manual in B&W.; The GE website has the longer manual in color.  You really need the long manual if you want to learn all about the camera. The CD includes a basic photo program, but I prefer the open-source IRFANview.  The camera comes with mini-USB and RCA video cables.In summary, this is a fine camera for anyone who wants the features it offers and a best-buy in its category.

Reviews.Title: A Camera with staying power! -DF
Reviews.Author: Debbie Folkert
Reviews.Content: Bought this camera in 2010. ..and haven't regretted it once. I LOVE the video option on it, and use it a lot. Snow storms, grandchild, pets, wildlife, vistas...and making records for insurance  and other legal purposes-this camera is very versatile. Zoom is excellent at capturing detail. Color is amazing. Pop-up flash works great and red eye is filtered out on most shots, but there is also an option to remove it too. (Most computers will do this also.) This camera also comes with a built-in microphone. It's not the best (you must really speak up to be heard-and make sure you're not covering it up on the body of the camera) -I really LOVE this feature too when video taping with it because you can identify what/where you are when on extended vacations and use the camera extensively. There view screen to review shots immediately and trash pics that aren't what you want. If you want a fantastic camera buy this one-you won't be sorry. DF

Reviews.Title: Nice Camera for the money.
Reviews.Author: Mark S. Batchelor "marksman"
Reviews.Content: There is a bit of a learning curve.  The manual is on CD which is not a problem for me.  After working with it for about an hour you will be taking 90% great pictures.  Have not had it long enough to rate durability.  Batteries do not seem to run down too quick.  I'm taking 3 MP photos for work and they look great.  14 megapixel photos should be good enough to blow up to poster size or bigger.

Reviews.Title: Great product
Reviews.Author: Priscilla Hall "Priscilla"
Reviews.Content: Great product would purchase again and recommend to family and friends. Takes great pictures and the capability to record is awesome.

Reviews.Title: Very good
Reviews.Author: Ledif Alberto Morales del Castillo
Reviews.Content: Excellent, I am very happy with these purchases...!  Thanks to all great service! continue so... isn't there any gift?  XD

Reviews.Title: It Works
Reviews.Author: Big DAVE
Reviews.Content: This camera takes great pictures, but it eats batteries like crazy. The only thing you can do is buy some good rechargable batteries and this will save you in the long run.

Reviews.Title: Very short life
Reviews.Author: AJP
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera in March 2011 and I had to send it back to the manufacturer in September 2011. They replaced the camera for a refurbished one that, after a few days of use, is ready to be shipped back to GE because died yesterday.Customer Service is #@&$#@!

Reviews.Title: Works Great
Reviews.Author: Eric Smith "Eric"
Reviews.Content: I recieved this idem though the mail i had it sent at 1 day shipping . i came the very next day. I read most of the reviews about it being a battery hog and i said. ill give it a try, shortly after buying the camria i ran across some Avansed Lithium battorys and they last me 8 months of battery life. When on normal Batterys i only had enouf power for 30 minutes at best. On the lithim batterys i spent around 24 hours with the camria on or longer and i did not run down the battorys. This was the best camria i have bought so far. ive had it for about a year now and it still works great and it does not have any problums. It comes with a camria lens lid.(i reccoment that you keep it on when you are not useing it) i took it off and i have some minor scratches on the lens becuase i took the case off.

Reviews.Title: Great price for a great product
Reviews.Author: Chris
Reviews.Content: This camera gives you great pictures if you use it right. It is semi easy to use, you just have to read the manual and practice with it. I learned the first day. The video isn't bad but isn't the greatest either. The sounded quality is very poor because they stuck the mic in between the lens and the flash. My favorite part about this camera is that it has a wide angle lens and all the features it has. It is not as hard or as featured as your typical DSLR cameras but has way more features than a point and shoot. Great product over all if you are a beginner to intermediate photographer.

Reviews.Title: I am really enjoying this camera...
Reviews.Author: HarmonyBrown
Reviews.Content: I am really enjoying this camera! It isn't extremely bulky, It takes great pictures, the video is nice and so is the sound. It has a manual mode, along with shutter and aperture priority options. I am still learning and figuring out some of the features of the camera. Overall, I am very satisfied with my purchase.

Reviews.Title: It's worth the money, just wish I knew how to use it!
Reviews.Author: Julie_NOLA "Julie"
Reviews.Content: Not too many complaints, however, the picture quality is just inconsistent.  I've had the camera for a couple months now and I just can take consistently good photos.  I have played around with the settings and I think I have gotten better.  Maybe it's just user error?!?!  All in all it's a decent camera for the price and am happy with the purchase.

Reviews.Title: I was expecting more, but is still a fine Camera.
Reviews.Author: Lester Caudill
Reviews.Content: I was expecting more from this camera, but it is still a fine camera, I just get better pictures from my Kodak easy share. I bought this camera to list items on Ebay it does not deliver the quality I wanted, when you zoom in the picture blurs.

Reviews.Title: GE X5 Digital Camera
Reviews.Author: A. Wallace
Reviews.Content: After 10 days of using this unit, I finally had to replace the batteries. For all the advanced funcrions this camera has, the battery life is exceptional. This camera is easy to use and delivers on all of it's advertised features. This camera is an exceptional value, performs as well as my $300 Canon.

Reviews.Title: LOVE IT :)
Reviews.Author: Laurie0530
Reviews.Content: I was so excited to have a nice camera at a wonderful price! I am loving it...Perfect everything...I give it a 100%!

Reviews.Title: great camera
Reviews.Author: Teresa Firmin "tee"
Reviews.Content: takes great pictures.  Can't keep away from my daughter she always wants to use it.  Glad I bought it for myself does lots of things my old camera didn't.  love to use to zoom feature for closeups. great SLR camera

Reviews.Title: Excellent 2nd Camera
Reviews.Author: C. Herndon
Reviews.Content: I own my own photography gallery. My second shooter often uses this camera at our shoots as a backup. It is easy to use and provides clear images in both portrait work and in the scenic and historic images we shoot. An excellent camera for  someone who is a serious amateur or budding professional

Reviews.Title: Is a good camera at a good price, I am pleased to buy this camera
Reviews.Author: José
Reviews.Content: good points:good pictures, easy to use, quick to load and take pictures, ergonomic, and so on. AA alkaline batteries (any brand) last 3 days continuous use average, a solution is to buy rechargeable batteries for Saving MoneyBad Points:Using alkaline AA batteries, not included SD memory(8GB recomended, is a semi-professional camera

Reviews.Title: Great deal for the money.
Reviews.Author: Jennifer
Reviews.Content: Batteries get chewed up by this camera.  Solved the problem by getting rechargeable batteries.  Great camera for the beginner photographer.  Allows person to learn the art without all the cash output.

Reviews.Title: GE X5 Power Pro
Reviews.Author: Techman
Reviews.Content: The camera came faster than I thought it would. When it arrived I was able to pick it up out of the box and begin using it. All controls are well placed and easy to use. Far more features than I expected but all I wanted in a good camera. The picture quality is excellent and it has great battery life. Well worth the money.

Reviews.Title: Excellent camera for the price!
Reviews.Author: LilyGirl
Reviews.Content: This camera is not Cannon or Nikon.  Not is it a Fuji.  However, for the price, it is a great camera.  It's comparable to a Kodak digital camera in quality and such.  I really like all the automated scene settings (i.e. - snow pics, night pics, museum pics, plant pics, and many more automated settings.  I also like this camera's ability to take decent pictures in the dark, and the flash is amazing.At first, I didn't know if I was going to like this camera.  But after using it a bit and getting used to it's settings, I'm very happy with it.  And it looks a whole lot more expensive than it is, mimicking the expensive SLR cameras.

Reviews.Title: GE Xp-5 decent zoom digital camera for the price
Reviews.Author: seany
Reviews.Content: GE X5 Power Pro Series 14.1 MP Digital Camera with 15X Optical ZoomIt is like your typical low-end digital cameras with lots of menu items to choose from. preset modes works well generally. macro tricky - sometimes gets fooled into off-focus.Drawback: wished it had screw-type threads for filters but given the zoom it may be physically impossible.Summary: decent camera for about $100.

Reviews.Title: lovin' it so far
Reviews.Author: Monica
Reviews.Content: I just got this for Christmas and have used it practically nonstop for the past two days. I'm no professional photographer, and I have only delved into the basic most obvious of the settings, but so far I am really loving it! and the photos I've taken with it have been beautiful, especially considering I am not doing anything extra other than trying to find a setting that sounds like the situation at hand (indoors, snow, etc). I have been very impressed and find it to be already waaaay better than the Canon camera it is replacing, which is really saying something as I had no issues with that camera and loved it, I just felt it was time to upgrade. I looked this model up at a few other websites and it seems to have good reviews all around. and of course for all of this, the price is a steal! obviously time will tell if I feel this way in a few months but based on the experience so far, I'm so glad I added it to my wish list... and got it!

Reviews.Title: A good Camera
Reviews.Author: May
Reviews.Content: I Bought this camera the last week.. and i can say .. the picture its good, the stabilization imagen is not a wonderfull thing but  passable?, yes.For the price is a excellent camera.sorry my english its not good

Reviews.Title: Love at first sight !
Reviews.Author: FHP
Reviews.Content: If you read the instruction manual from the CD included with the camera and applywhat you have found there you will have a great experience with this camera.  Thiscamera is a great performer at this price and you will get more than you paid forbelieve me.  Would buy again and recommend to anyone looking for a useable andeconomical camera experience.

Reviews.Title: GE brings good things to life
Reviews.Author: D. Townsend "atruesoldier"
Reviews.Content: I was a little skeptical about buying this camera. The reason why is because GE is not known for making Cameras. After reading some positive reviews on several sites, i bought this one. I was pleasantly surprised when i received my camera. It has the look of those expensive cameras but cost half the price. If you are new to this type of camera, there is a lot to learn about the different modes. I would recommend this camera for people wanting a get a taste of what Professional Cameras have to offer.  The only thing i would change is the AA batteries with rechargeable packs.

Reviews.Title: Worth the Money
Reviews.Author: The Lud Men
Reviews.Content: I spent a couple of days reading and really doubt about purchasing this camara. Honestly, this camara is amazing and worth so more money than with it costed me! Picture quality is impacable, and features are so updated and fun! it is a great camara.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera for the price
Reviews.Author: Big Daddy
Reviews.Content: Great camera for the price.  The zoom is great.  It is a little bulky due to the 4 AA batteries, but I expected that so it is no big deal to me.  The image quality is good.  I am not seriously into photography, but mainly am using this for family photo's and such and it has worked well.

Reviews.Title: Great camera for the price
Reviews.Author: J. Woodward "lobsta497"
Reviews.Content: I ready many many reviews before purchasing this camera.  We have had it for a  few weeks now and we love taking pics with it.  As with any new product you need to play with it to perfect it for your use.  Try all the settings and see what they do and then you will be ready for anything.  The zoom on this camera is great. We took a picture of a hawk a ways away on top of a pole it came our great, you could see his beak was open and everything.  If you go to Sears to buy it tell them you saw it cheaper online and they will go to the computer and check it out and give you that price.  We paid 134.99 I think and didnt have to wait for it to ship or anything.  Overall we are very pleased and would recommend this camera to anyone looking to take some good pics.

Reviews.Title: Best $ Camera Buy Yet
Reviews.Author: Michael T
Reviews.Content: WOW!!!What a lot of camera for so little $'s - I'm REALLY impressed with this little guy.After reading the manual (good idea) and playing around with it - I cannot believe that you can buy this much camera for this much money - it just blows me away.  It's made in China - but doesn't feel cheap by any means. One thing I did - right out of the box - was color in the prominent "GE" on the flash cover and right over the lens with a black sharpie - to essentially hide it.One great feature is the lens extends when you turn on the camera - popping off the lens cap.  No more trying to take pics with the lens cap on with this little guy. I realy appreciate the viewfinder in addition to the lcd screen to compose the best pictures.The camera is really "point and shoot" with the automatically set settings in most selectable modes - making picture taking fun again!!With Amazons pricing and customer service/returns policy - I'm recommending this to all my friends and family for a camera with good, sharp pictures at an extremely reasonable price.

Reviews.Title: GE X5
Reviews.Author: csidedr
Reviews.Content: great for static shots, feature rich for this price range, but lag time is way too long for use in sports.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera!
Reviews.Author: anna
Reviews.Content: I borrowed this camera from a friend to take pictures of my livestock.  I have a real problem getting pics of them because they all come running when they see me enter the pastures.  The 15x zoom is a great feature, allowing me to take pics without having to go in the pastures or make myself noticeable when I do.  The 14.1 megapixels provides you with some real nice quality pics!  I haven't yet figured out all of the features on it.  I'm not a pro by a longshot!  But, after borrowing the camera and seeing what kind of quality pics it takes, I decided this was a definite must have for my livestock business and for my family as well.

Reviews.Title: Moving into the 21st century
Reviews.Author: david heathcott
Reviews.Content: My last camera was a canon 35 mm slr and was overdue for replacement.This camera is full of cool stuff and I'm tickled pink.Dont have a cd drive so have to get by with the printed guide but I can figure it out.Wish I'd bought a memory card too.

Reviews.Title: You get what you pay for!
Reviews.Author: Tyrone
Reviews.Content: Was excited to get this camera! What a disapointment! For some reason as I was eagerly setting up the camera, the lens zoomed for no reason. I did not press the zoom feature. Now the lens won't retract, I get an error message that the lens is obstructed,though I can't see anything blocking the lens. In any case after awhile it shuts its self off. Along with the lens problem the camera won't focus.I RMAed the camera to GE, hopefully I will get a new one back! Though it cost me $11 to ship it back. If they decide I did something wrong then I'll be out $122 dollars and get back a non working camera.I suppose I should add I did not drop it either!Perhaps this GE product is too good to be true! If you look at the prices for the features on similar cameras?????? I know in 3 years of owning a Kodak Z710 refurb, I've never had this problem! Buyer be aware! Brought from Capital Electronics.1/11/11 Got this from GE RMA:Thank you for choosing to purchase a GE digital camera.After carefully testing your camera, we have determined that it is covered under warranty.  We will be replacing your defective camera with a brand new camera.  Please allow up to 21 business days to receive your package within the USA and up to 42 days when going to Canada.  Tracking information will be sent via e-mail from UPS.Customer satisfaction is of the utmost importance at GE Digital Cameras. Coupled with our line of quality products, we intend on making our customers' experience with our cameras most enjoyable and satisfactory.Thank You,Lupe Mora

Reviews.Title: GREAT CAMERA BUT EATS BATTERIES LIKE CRAZY
Reviews.Author: M. May
Reviews.Content: I love this camera.  It is easy to use and has great features but it eats batteries very fast.  Next time I buy a camera, it will have a rechargable battery, not AA batteries that have to be replaced frequently.

Reviews.Title: X5 rocks
Reviews.Author: Alec J. Seastrand "W.N.T.R. Productions"
Reviews.Content: I've had this for a day or two.  the cats knocked it off the piano and onto the floor, and the thing is entirely unscathed.  The smile detection is a great feature, and the video image quality is fantastic.the AA's have a plus and minus, plus being you can have instant power anywhere, minus being you have to pay for it.the 15x zoom is great.small delay when previewing, but that's not achieved for under $300 anyway... another great product from GE.

Reviews.Title: Great Buy
Reviews.Author: M B
Reviews.Content: Don't wait its a good buy! Took it on hunting trip. Great photos. keep the lens clean and enjoy pro shots.

Reviews.Title: Not a very good quality camera
Reviews.Author: Tambo
Reviews.Content: This was my second one to purchase.  I only had this camera a year and it quit working. I have now learned my lesson.

Reviews.Title: Could be better
Reviews.Author: Ayanna
Reviews.Content: Freezes up but has good quality. It caused a small virus on my computer. It changes camera settings on its own

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: Agustin Graña
